laboratory_examinations.findings: Reduced amplitudes (approximately 60% of normal) and prolonged latencies (approximately 40 ms increased) on flash VEP.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Improved amplitudes (approximately 82% right eye; approximately 74% left eye) and latencies in both eyes after riboflavin treatment.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the brain and orbits
laboratory_examinations.findings: No intracranial abnormalities, but the optic nerves and tracts appeared mildly decreased in size.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI brain imaging did not demonstrate any change.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Slightly low for age at 34 μmol/L.
Nonspecific abnormalities including mildly low glutamine and arginine levels, and elevated proline and α-aminobutyric acid levels.
Normal with low homovanillic acid and 5-hydroxyindoleacetic acid.
Showed small median compound muscle action potentials (CMAPs) but normal peroneal CMAPs.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Sensory testing revealed absent median nerve action potentials from digit 2 and small for age sural nerve action potentials.
